revised_title: Stochastic Theory of Nucleation of Quantized Vortices in Superfluid Helium
tldr: This article explores the stochastic theory of the nucleation of quantized vortices in superfluid helium, examining the role of thermal fluctuations in the nucleation process. The authors develop a Langevin equation for vortex rings and a Fokker-Planck equation, applying the theory to various problems, including nucleation in an unbounded fluid, nucleation in a finite channel, and vortex formation by ions. The study provides insights into the complex nature of critical velocities in liquid helium and the dynamics of superfluidity.
